refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect2.title: ThunarVfsMonitor
refsect2.para: The ThunarVfsMonitor contains private data only, and should be accessed using the functions below.

refsect2.title: enum ThunarVfsMonitorEvent
refsect2.para: Describes an event that occurred on a ThunarVfsMonitorHandle.

listitem.simpara: a file or directory was changed.
a file or directory was created.
a file or directory was deleted.

refsect2.title: ThunarVfsMonitorHandle
refsect2.para: A handle on a file system entity, which is currently watched by a ThunarVfsMonitor.

refsect2.title: ThunarVfsMonitorCallback ()
refsect2.programlisting: void (*ThunarVfsMonitorCallback) (ThunarVfsMonitor *monitor, ThunarVfsMonitorHandle *handle, ThunarVfsMonitorEvent event, ThunarVfsPath *handle_path, ThunarVfsPath *event_path, gpointer user_data);
refsect2.para: The prototype for callback functions that will be called by a ThunarVfsMonitor whenever one of its associated ThunarVfsMonitorHandles notice a change.

listitem.simpara: a ThunarVfsMonitor.
a ThunarVfsMonitorHandle.
the event that occurred.
the ThunarVfsPath that was specified when registering the handle.
the ThunarVfsPath on which the event occurred.
the user data that was specified when registering the handle with the monitor.

refsect2.title: thunar_vfs_monitor_get_default ()
refsect2.para: Returns the shared ThunarVfsMonitor instance. The caller is responsible to call g_object_unref() on the returned object when no longer needed.

listitem.simpara: a reference to the shared ThunarVfsMonitor instance.

refsect2.title: thunar_vfs_monitor_add_directory ()
refsect2.programlisting: ThunarVfsMonitorHandle* thunar_vfs_monitor_add_directory (ThunarVfsMonitor *monitor, ThunarVfsPath *path, ThunarVfsMonitorCallback callback, gpointer user_data);
refsect2.para: Registers path as directory for monitor. monitor will invoke callback whenever it notices a change to the directory to which path refers or any of the files within the directory.
The returned ThunarVfsMonitorHandle can be used to remove the path from monitor using thunar_vfs_monitor_remove().

listitem.simpara: a ThunarVfsMonitor.
the ThunarVfsPath of the directory that should be watched.
the callback function to invoke.
additional data to pass to callback.
the ThunarVfsMonitorHandle for the new watch.

refsect2.title: thunar_vfs_monitor_add_file ()
refsect2.programlisting: ThunarVfsMonitorHandle* thunar_vfs_monitor_add_file (ThunarVfsMonitor *monitor, ThunarVfsPath *path, ThunarVfsMonitorCallback callback, gpointer user_data);
refsect2.para: Registers path as file with monitor. monitor will then invoke callback whenever it notices a change to the file to which path refers.
The returned ThunarVfsMonitorHandle can be used to remove the path from monitor using thunar_vfs_monitor_remove().

listitem.simpara: a ThunarVfsMonitor.
the ThunarVfsPath of the file that should be watched.
the callback function to invoke.
additional data to pass to callback.
the ThunarVfsMonitorHandle for the new watch.
a ThunarVfsMonitor.
a valid ThunarVfsMonitorHandle for monitor.

refsect2.title: thunar_vfs_monitor_feed ()
refsect2.para: Explicitly injects the given event into monitors event processing logic.

listitem.simpara: a ThunarVfsMonitor.
the ThunarVfsMonitorEvent that should be emulated.
the ThunarVfsPath on which event took place.

refsect2.title: thunar_vfs_monitor_wait ()
refsect2.para: Suspends the execution of the current thread until the monitor has processed all currently pending events. The calling thread must own a reference on the monitor!
This method should never be called from the main thread or you'll lock up your application!!

listitem.simpara: a ThunarVfsMonitor.
